CAS492.name: Special Topics

CAS825.name: Mass Communication and Public Health
CAS825.description: Health communication campaigns in domestic and international contexts. Focus on principles of effective communication.

CAS826.name: Health Communication for Diverse Populations
CAS826.description: Theory, research, and practice of communicating with specialized populations in clinical and public health contexts. Emphasis on interpersonal and small-group strategies.

CAS827.name: Digital Media Strategies
CAS827.description: Current issues and trends in digital multimedia technologies and applications, media planning, promotional media mix plans.
CAS827.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major or in the Digital Media Graduate Certificate.

CAS828.name: Persuasion Techniques for Working Professionals
CAS828.description: Application of scientific principles of persuasion and compliance gaining, persuasive message construction, audience response to persuasion attempts.
CAS828.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major.

CAS829.name: Evaluation Techniques for Working Professionals
CAS829.description: Basic communication evaluation methods, including the process of evaluation, basics of quantitative and qualitative research methods, understanding elementary data analysis, sampling/recruiting and reporting and disseminating results.
CAS829.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major.

CAS831.name: Digital Content Creation, Curation and Promotion
CAS831.description: Creation of content for digital media including current social media, digital journalism and interactive media, design principles, promotion of digital media.
CAS831.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major or in the Digital Media Graduate Certificate.

CAS832.name: Strategic Message Development
CAS832.description: Designing effective corporate messages, conducting effective stakeholder analysis, setting outcome parameters, and engaging your audience.
CAS832.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major.

CAS833.name: Crisis Communication
CAS833.description: Best practices for risk communication, public relations and reputation management, case studies of corporate crisis, crisis management plan development.
CAS833.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major or in the Organizational Communication for Leadership Graduate Certificate.

CAS835.name: Branding and Image Communication
CAS835.description: Branding to differentiate a product, service or company from its competitors, how brands are created, managed and grown, brand equity.
CAS835.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major or in the Digital Media Graduate Certificate.

CAS837.name: Catalyst Thinking in the C-Suite
CAS837.description: Knowledge, skills and abilities relevant to organizational leaders including communication, collaboration, creativity, community, conflict, change and core values.
CAS837.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major or in the Organizational Communication for Leadership Graduate Certificate.

CAS838.name: Organizational Communication for Leaders and Entrepreneurs
CAS838.description: Fundamentals of organizational communication, organizational mission statement, leadership, building successful teams, facilitating meetings, and communicating innovation.
CAS838.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major or in the Organizational Communication for Leadership Graduate Certificate.

CAS839.name: Media Analytics for Communication Professionals
CAS839.description: Media analytics. Application by communication professionals, journalists and advertising and PR professionals.
CAS839.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major or in the Media Analytics Graduate Certificate.

CAS840.name: Audience Analytics
CAS840.description: Concepts of digital analytics and use of live data to generate consumer insights for website or mobile applications, such as user profiles, traffic sources, navigation patterns, conversion ratios and path to purchase. Interpretation of analytics and application in strategic plans.
CAS840.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major or in the Media Analytics Graduate Certificate.

CAS841.name: Social Media Storytelling
CAS841.description: Qualitative skills regarding social media storytelling, including finding, making sense, verifying, assessing and creating stories for online networking platforms.
CAS841.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major or in the Media Analytics Graduate Certificate.

CAS842.name: Professional Communication Ethics
CAS842.description: Ethical responsibilities for industry, community and personal standards. Foundational principles and modern applications of ethics in various communication media, organizational contexts, and across specific cultures and countries.
CAS842.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major.

CAS844.name: Capstone/Practicum
CAS844.description: Final project designed to integrate program learning and demonstrate facility with digital communication.
CAS844.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Strategic Communication Major.

CAS850.name: Health Informatics
CAS850.description: Resources, devices, and methods required to optimize the acquisition, storage, retrieval, and use of information in health and biomedicine.
CAS850.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing. Approval of college.

CAS890.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences. Approval of college.

CAS921.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or approval of college.

CAS975.description: A survey of qualitative and quantitative research design including validity and reliability, hypothesis formation, sampling, ethics, survey, experimental, ethnographic, observational and mixed methods.

CAS990.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or approval of college.

CAS991.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or approval of college.

CAS992.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year

CAS992.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or approval of college.

CAS993.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or approval of college.

CAS994.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences and open to graduate students in the College of Engineering and open to graduate students in the College of Nursing.

CAS999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
